quote: Egalitarian and meritocracy-based software development collaboration
author: Siddharth Anand, user of Apache Avro, Spark, Airflow, and Hive since 2003; contributor to Apache Airflow, Spark, Livy

quote: Community for collaboration and cooperation.
author: John, Apache Hadoop, Hive, HBase, Cassandra, Druid, Flink, Sentry, Zookeeper, Solr, Iceberg, Impala, Kudu, Pig, Flume, Sqoop, Yetus, Parquet, Spark, Arrow, BigTop, Maven, Ivy, Kerby, Mesos, Oozie user for 4 years; contributor to Apache Hadoop, Hive, HBase, Druid, Flink, Sentry, Iceberg, Impala, Kudu, Parquet, Spark, Kerby

quote: Transparency, sharing, community collaboration
author: Phil Zampino, 10 year user of Apache Knox, Commons, Hadoop, HTTP Client, and contributor to Apache Knox, Hadoop, Lucene and others

quote: Open Source Software which can safely be used in commercial software
author: K, user of Apache HTTP Server, Poi, Wicket, Tomcat and more    over 18 years. Apache Poi contributor

quote: Essential components for infrastructure and applications for projects in education
author: Professor Alexis Olivo, 14 year user of Apache HTTP Server, Flex, Cordova

quote: Great open source software produced by a community that cares about quality and sharing
author: MC, 9 year user of Apache Hadoop, Spark, VXQuery, AsterixDB, Pig, Hive    VXQuery, AsterixDB

quote: A tried and tested, mature approach to collaborate development. One whereby it shows that a community over code approach really does result in a better product.
author: Tim Robertson, 20 year user of Apache projects including Beam, Hadoop, HBase, Hive, Spark, ORC, Tomcat, Solr, and contributor on Apache Beam, Hive, Hadoop, HBase, Solr

quote: Great Community for developing open source code with a permissive license
author: Anonymous, 20 year contributor to Apache Commons

quote: Build a community, instead of code.
author: Wei Chen, 8 year user of Apache Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, PredictionIO, Marvin, Toree

quote: To me it means recognition being tied to the individual, it means developing projects on neutral ground, it means bridging not only time zones, cultures, geographies but also institutions and organizations...as a friend once said, it's also a place where what you receive outweighs what you invest.
author: Anonymous Apache Project Mentor

quote: Guide lines or Bible
author: Koji, 18 year user of Apache Lucene, Solr, OpeNLP, Mahout, Spark, Commons, contributor to Apache Solr

quote: more open, driving me to communicate
author: Jialin Qiao, 3 year committer on Apache IoTDB (incubating)

quote: A way to let your work benefit more people, a way to grow tech depth quickly and also help to build relationships.
author: Weiwei Yang, user and committer on Apache Hadoop for 8 years

quote: To be free to contribute and use Apache projects for the daily work.
author: Anonymous, 14 year contributor to Apache Wicket

quote: True dev env
author: Anonymous, Apache ESME contributor for 8 years

quote: The Apache Way is our industry-leading Seal of Approval. It is the foundations guarantee, and the users' guarantee, that what is released is governed, tried and tested, and passes muster. It is an assurance that things are handled in the open, that there are no hidden surprises or caveats, that this is quality assured.
author: Daniel Gruno, 20 year user of Apache HTTP Server, Cordova, Kibble, and Lucene, contributor to Apache httpd, Kibble, TrafficServer, Tinkerpop, Steve

quote: Make friends and learn something new
author: Wei Zhang, 10+ year user and contributor to Apache OFBiz, Tomcat, Commons

quote: High quality open source
author: Piotr, Apache Cassandra, Spark, and Commons user for over 15 years, contributor to Apache Cassandra, Spark

quote: Community driven software | diverse and open communities | power to those who do
author: Christian Schneider, 19 year user of Apache HTTP Server and Tomcat, contributor to Apache Karaf, Camel, CXF, Kafka, ActiveMQ, Aries, Felix

quote: Open for any one to use and contribute. Doesn't matter whether a contributor is young or experienced, all are welcomed with open hearts. Always work with passion towards making a project better for the users.
author: Imesha Sudasingha, 4 year user of Apache Zookeeper, Maven, Tomcat, Apache2, OODT, Commons, HttpComponents, contributor to Apache OODT, Curator, DRAT, Airavata

quote: Community over the Code
author: Von Gosling, 10 year user of Apache RocketMQ, Dubbo, Spark, Flink, Tomcat, contributor to Apache RocketMQ, Kafka, Dubbo (incubating), Flink, Tomcat, Hadoop

quote: Community is more important than code
author: Kexianjun, contributor to Apache Dubbo (incubating), user of Apache RocketMQ, Zookeeper, Tomcat, Kafka and other Apache projects for 3 years

quote: Collaboration
author: Anonymous user of Apache projects for ~25 years, including Apache Ant, Axis2, Batik, Camel, Cocoon, Apache Commons, CXF, Derby, Directory Server, Directory Studio, FreeMarker, Groovy, HTTP Server, HttpComponents, JMeter, Karaf, Log4, Maven, OpenJPA, OpenOffice, PDFBox, POI, Solr, Subversion, Tomcat, Velocity, Xalan, Xerces    Camel, CXF, Groovy, Karaf, Maven, PDFBox, Tomcat

quote: open source and industry standard
author: Jiang, 5 year user of Apache Spark, Hadoop, Sqoop, Flume, Kafka, HBase, Hive

quote: Community / Meritocracy
author: Patrick, using Apache Tomcat, PDFBox, Commons, HTTPd, Lucene, Tika, Maven,  POI, HttpComponents for 18 years

quote: better quality
author: Kimm King, 10 year user and contributor to Apache Dubbo (incubating), RocketMQ, Ignite, ActiveMQ, Ignite, Kafka, Camel, ShardingSphere (incubating), and more

quote: A best way to improve programming skills
author: Chen, Apache Dubbo (incubating) and RocketMQ user for 5 years

quote: Freedom, technique first
author: Xiangdong Huang, 8 year user of Apache Cassandra, Hadoop, Tomcat, Maven, contributor to Apache IoTDB (incubating)

quote: openness, collaboration, community effort, exchange of ideas and thoughts
author: Grzegorz Grzybek, user of Apache Maven, CXF, Camel, Karaf, Aries, Felix, Commons, HTTPd, Tomcat, Derby, ActiveMQ, Groovy (incubating), log4j, Xerces, Xalan for 17 years, contributor to Apache Karaf, Camel, Aries, CXF

quote: community first development process
author: Lukasz Lenart, user of Apache Struts and Commons for 16 years, committer on Apache Struts and Spark

quote: Power
author: Tang, 10 years user of Apache RocketMQ, Kafka, Commons, Log4j, Tomcat, HttpComponents, contributor to Apache RocketMQ and Skywalking (incubating)

quote: Open, Free and Organized
author: Xuchuanyin, user of Apache Commons, Hadoop, Spark, Carbondata (incubating), Parquet, ORC, Zookeeper for 5 years, contributing to Apache ORC and Carbondata (incubating)

quote: Building great software as a peaceful, non-competitive community with outmost respect of each other
author: Anonymous user of Apache projects since 2000, including httpd, Maven, Ant, Commons, Sling, Felix, Jackrabbit, Cordova, Openwhisk (incubating), contributor to Apache Sling, Felix, Jackrabbit, Cordova

quote: Community over Code.
author: Mick Semb Wever, 19 year user of Apache projects including Cassandra, NetBeans (incubating), Zipkin (incubating), Spark, Kafka, Hadoop, Arvo, Groovy, HttpComponents, JMeter, Maven, Mesos, OpenOffice, Parquet, Shiro, Tiles, httpd, Tomcat, Commons, log4j, and Apache Cassandra committer

quote: save money, use the best opensource technology, I think so
author: Hushunliang, user of Apache projects for about 10 years, including Apache Tomcat, Dubbo (incubating), Spark, RocketMQ

quote: I don't think much about the Apache way, but it's fun and sometimes rewarding to participate in a few projects.
author: Anonymous user of Apache Tomcat, httpd, POI, Commons, Batik over the past two decades; contributor to Apache POI, Tika, Commons

quote: More learning opportunities
author: Liuchunlong, three year user of Apache RocketMQ, Lucene, Tomcat, Struts, Maven    and contributor to RocketMQ

quote: one of the best open source organizations
author: Piean, 6+ year user of Apache Commons, Druid (incubating), Dubbo (incubating), Maven, and contributor to RocketMQ

quote: Gaining by sharing
author: Niels Basjes, ~25 years user of Apache httpd, Tomcat, Hadoop, Pig, HBase, Hive, Flink, Beam, Kafka, Avro, Parquet, Commons, and contributor to Apache Avro, Hadoop, Pig, HBase, Hive, Flink, Beam

quote: Convenient and swift
author: FangQi Cao, one year user of Apache RocketMQ

quote: A way to build communities that work together to build projects that can be used by anybody, anywhere.
author: Bruno P. Kinoshita, 10+ year user and committer to several Apache Commons components, Jena, OpenNLP, Arrow, Kafka

quote: Collaborative software development, consistently high-quality software
author: Henry Li, user and contributor to Apache RocketMQ for 7 years

quote: A way to ensure software quality
author: Giovanni Bechis, 20+ year user of Apache HTTP Server and committer on Apache SpamAssassin

quote: Collaborative, collegial, common interest, (mostly) vendor neutral, development of software for a better planet
author: Anonymous user of Apache HTTP Server for 20 years

quote: A place for collaborating on a project with a permissive open source license
author: Anonymous, 17 year user of Apache POI, httpd, Tomcat, Sling, Lucene, PDFBox, Commons, Jackrabbit, Pulsar, Incubator and committer to Apache OpenOffice, Incubator, POI, Solr, Tika.

quote: Freedom and collaboration
author: Christian, user of Apache Projects that include httpd, Tomcat, NetBeans, and other Java-related projects for 23 years

quote: really free software, good community
author: Anonymous user of about 30 different Apache projects over 16 years, and committer on Apache Sling

quote: Openness, meritocracy
author: Attila Bukor, 15 year user of Apache HTTP Server, Maven, Hadoop, Kudu, ZooKeeper, PonyMail, Whimsy, and committer to Apache Kudu, Hadoop, HBase, Kafka, ZooKeeper, Hive, Impala, Sentry

quote: It is a way to build communities and software by giving a bit in order to get a lot.
author: Ted Dunning, 10 year user of Apache Spark, Commons, Flink, Drill, Maven, Calcite, Parquet, PonyMail, Whimsy, Zeppelin, Zookeeper, and committer on Apache Drill, Spark, Flink, Calcite

quote: Meritocraty, transparency, business compatibility
author: Cédric Damioli, 17 year user of Apache Cocoon, Jackrabbit, Solr, and many others, contributor to Apache Cocoon, Jackrabbit, and Lucene.

quote: A revolutionary way to collaborate openly and efficiently across organizations, cultures and timezones
author: Bertrand Delacretaz, 20 year user and committer to Apache Sling, Jackrabbit Oak, Felix, Lucene, OpenWhisk (incubating) and many others

quote: Community over Competition. Pooling expertise for the benefit of all. What you give will come back to you 10-fold.
author: Matt Foley, 8+ year user and contributor to Apache Hadoop, Spark, HBase, Maven    Hadoop, Spark, HBase, Maven, Ambari, Hive, Metron, NiFi

quote: A strong community where consensus and do are the keys factors
author: Olivier Heintz, 11 year user and contributor to Apache OFBiz

quote: Learning from the best. Being constructively criticized by the best. Intellectual stimulation. Friendship.
author: Dawid Weiss, user and contributor to Apache Lucene, Solr, Maven, Ant, Jakarta, HTTPD for ~20 years

quote: Collaborating to improve the products delivered by the projects. Achieving such results through consensus.
author: Anonymous user and contributor to Apache HTTPD, OFBiz, Directory, ServiceMix for 10 years

quote: Global teamwork and collaboration
author: Gandhirajan N, 2 year user of Apache Commons and contributor to Apache Ctakes, Cordova

quote: Creating, evolving and improving through sharing and openness
author: Anonymous user and committer to Apache Karaf, ActiveMQ, Camel, Maven, and Commons

quote: A guideline
author: Radovan Semancik, ~20 year user of Apache httpd, Tomcat, Commons, Directory, CXF, Mina, http-client, and committer on Directory, CXF, Mina

quote: Community, respect, innovation.
author: Lefty Leverenz, user and contributor to Apache Hive and ORC for 7 years

quote: Community over code and a great place to meet good people
author: Francois Papon, 14 year user of Apache Karaf, Camel, ActiveMQ, Tomcat, CXF, Log4j, Struts, Shiro, Unomi, committer on Apache Karaf, Camel, Shiro, Unomi

quote: Open, collaborative
author: Anonymous user and contributor to Apache Hadoop, Flink, Spark, Hive    for 9 years

quote: a good structure to build a strong community and good quality software
author: Etienne, user of “a lot” of Apache projects for 15 years, and contributor to Apache Beam, Karaf, ActiveMQ, Camel, Syncope, CXF, Kafka, Avro, Ranger, Spark, Flink and more

quote: Contribution to open source community means ... sharing well reviewed code with many enthusiastic developers to try and utilize and build on powerful features that are already developed.
author: Mehul Parikh, 4 year user of Apache Ranger, Atlas, Hadoop, Hive, HBase, Knox, Storm, Kafka, Ambari

quote: Community driven, open, to a high standard
author: Duncan, 15 year user of Apache projects including Brooklyn, jclouds, ActiveMQ, Ambari, JMeter, Hadoop, Struts, httpd, and contributor to Brooklyn and jclouds

quote: openness, equality, meritocracy, stewardship
author: Radu Cotescu, 6 year user and contributor to Apache Sling, Felix, Jackrabbit Oak, Maven, Tika

quote: Open Source, Reliable, Scalable
author: Kartik Reddy, user of Apache Flink, NiFi, Kafka, Hadoop, Spark, Tomcat for 3 years

quote: Vendor-neutral collaborative open source software development
author: Anonymous 8 year user of Apache Jena, Spark, Hadoop, Commons, Mesos, Zookeeper, and contributor to Apache Jena, Spark, Mesos

quote: Apache contributes a lot of valuable infrastructure without trying to push opinions on how and where it should and should not be used.
author: Ilya, user of Apache Commons, Hibernate, Lucene, Solr, Ignite, Ant, Maven, Xerces for more than a decade, and committer on Apache Solr, Ignite

quote: Community software development
author: Sergio Fernandez, 15 year user of Apache Commons, Spark, Beam, Flink, Marmotta, Solr, Lucene, and committer to Apache Commons, Marmotta, MXNet

quote: reliable software and libraries
author: Tushar Joshi, user of Apache Commons, ServiceMix, Tomcat, NetBeans, OpenOffice, FOP, Xerces, log4j, httpd, Hadoop since 2000, and contributor to Apache Hadoop, Tomcat, NetBeans

quote: Community, Consensus and Open Process
author: Dennis Kieselhorst, 15 year user of Apache Tomcat, HTTPD, HttpComponents, Kafka, and committer to Apache Commons, CXF, MyFaces, Maven

quote: High quality software that I can rely on and contribute to
author: Anonymous user of Apache Kafka, Zookeeper, Commons, Maven and committer to Apache Kafka for many years

quote: Community over code
author: Anonymous user of Apache Unomi, Karaf, Tomcat, Maven, Commons, Pluto, Jackrabbit, Lucene for 20 years, and committer to Apache Unomi, Karaf, Jackrabbit

quote: longevity through community
author: Alex Heneveld, 15 year user of Apache Brooklyn, jclouds, httpd, Commons, Karaf, Cassandra, and more, contributor to Apache Brooklyn, jclouds

quote: A high set of standards that projects and developers are held to, that encourages involvement but does so in a way that insures sustainability and legal protection for the future.
author: Nick, ~20 year user of Apache httpd, Guacamole, Tomcat, NetBeans, Directory, Maven, contributor to Apache Guacamole

quote: International collaboration, community, fun
author: Vincent, user of Apache Maven, Ant, httpd, Tomcat for 20 years, and contributor to Apache Maven and some projects in the Apache Incubator

quote: collaboration, sharing, learning
author: Yifei Zhang, 10 year user and contributor to Apache HTTP Server, Hadoop, NiFi, Cassandra

quote: working together with a shared sense of ownership over the community's project.
author: Anonymous user and committer to Apache HTTP Server, Zeppelin, Whimsy, Tomcat, Tika, CouchDB, and Commons, for 19 years

quote: Collaboration
author: Anonymous user of Apache Jackrabbit Oak, Lucene, Solr, and others for too many years to remember, and contributor to Apache Jackrabbit

quote: an attempt to codify norms of effective tightly-knit groups to work at scale and across long (geographic and temporal) distances
author: Robert, user of Apache httpd, Beam, Flink, Arrow, Commons, Ant, Groovy for 10 years, and committer to Beam and Flink

quote: Technology that matter with no Strings attached.
author: Rafael Weingärtner, 10 year user of Apache CloudStack, most of the Java Commons, Maven, and others, and contributor to Apache CloudStack

quote: Project management independent from commercial interests.
author: Dmitriy Pavlov, 12 year user and contributor to Apache Ignite, Tomcat, Kafka

quote: Open and community driven
author: Anonymous user and contributor to Apache Hadoop and Spark for 16 years

quote: In my experience within a small ‘community’, the slogan does not mean much: Evolution/outcome/output of projects are very different depending on which of the underlying tenets (consensus, involvement, technical argumentation, common good, vote participation, onboarding, ...) are favored, or not, by ‘influential’ people. Influence and ‘meritocracy’ are not always aligned and the former trumps the latter...
author: Gilles, 12 year user and contributor to several Apache Commons Math projects

quote: Share knowledge with other engineers. Solve common problems. Be polite and create community
author: Enrico Olivelli, user of 19 years of Apache Tomcat, Bookkeeper, ZooKeeper, HBase, Calcite, Oltu, Commons, James, SpamAssasisin, Groovy, Subversion, Curator, Maven, Ant, Hadoop, Kafka, Pulsar, NetBeans, contributor to Apache Bookkeeper, Zookeeper, Calcite, Tomcat, Curator, Maven

quote: Imagine there's no heaven…(full song lyrics)...
author: Robert, 20 year user of Apache httpd, Tomcat, Tinkerpop, ActiveMQ, Ant, Cassandra, Camel, Commons, Groovy, Ignite, JMeter, Lucene, Maven, and many more...contributor to Apache TinkerPop

quote: Trying to be courteous, open minded to anyone, helpful, and merit based. The community spirit is also quite refreshing, in the sense, that the power of the community is quite larger than the sum of the parts. We also seem to maintain some anonymity in that the world en masse doesn't see that we touch them in their day to day lives as much as say Apple does.
author: Rob Tompkins, 20 year user of Apache httpd, Commons, Tomcat, and contributor to Apache Spark and Hadoop.

quote: Building a sustainable and productive community for moving software projects forward.
author: Christopher, 20 year user and contributor to Apache Accumulo, Fluo, Maven, Hadoop, ZooKeeper, Thrift, Commons, Tomcat

quote: Challenging.
author: Lee Dongjin, user of Apache Hadoop, Giraph, Spark, Kafka, Livy, Mahout, HBase for 7 years, contributor to Apache Spark, Kafka.

quote: ASF License + governance process for software
author: Sean, 12 year user of Apache Spark, Parquet, Arrow, Hadoop, Kafka, contributor to Apache Spark

quote: People over the code. Complete transparency in the process. Keeping the process open. Making the community welcoming for beginners.
author: Gurudatt, 2 year user of Apache Kafka, Hadoop, Zookeeper, NiFi, Spark, Tomcat

quote: Be excellent to each other
author: Anonymous 9 year user of Apache PDFBox, Tomcat, POI, NetBeans, log4j

quote: Personally, it gives me great pride to share and collaborate with the larger open source community and the Apache Way is the best way to do that. Professionally, the breadth and quality of Apache projects means I can be competitive regardless of the domain of software I work in.
author: Raymond Augé, user of Apache Ant, Aries, Commons, CXF, Derby, Felix, Gronimo, HC, Ivy, Kafka, Logging, Maven, Mina, Lucene, Tomcat, Velocity...since Since Apache Httpd Server was a thing, contributor to Apache Aries, Felix, Geronimo

quote: Shared ideas and a drive towards open innovation fostered by a community of passionate people
author: Anonymous user of Apache ActiveMQ, Camel, Commons, Derby for more than 10 years, contributor to Apache ActiveMQ, Camel, Kafka

quote: Open development, contributor friendly
author: Adrian Muraru, 10 year user of Apache Kafka, Cassandra and contributor to HBase

quote: A sense of community around software technology
author: Nick, 20 year user of Apache Metron, Hadoop, Spark, Storm, Kafka, Zookeeper, HBase, Commons, contributor to Apche Metron

quote: Free Open Source software that's licensed such that anyone is free to use it in any project for free and open, consensus & merit based development communities.
author: Anonymous user for 10 years of Apache Lucene, Solr, Ant, Zookeeper, Tika, Groovy, Tomcat, log4j2, Subversion, OpenOffice, Shiro, Spark, Velocity, PDFBox, Zeppelin, POI, Jena, River, JMeter, Kafka, Ivy, httpd, Cassandra, HttpClient, James, Struts contributor to Apache Lucene, Solr, Ant, ManifoldCF

quote: Not much at the moment, as a new PPMC member this will need to change but at the moment I find the culture very alien to me. Just the amount of abbreviations, rules, etc., ecosystem that come with Apache is staggering and information is scattered or written with too much assumed insider knowledge.
author: Anonymous 20 year user of Apache Kafka, Cordova, Cassandra, ActiveMQ, Zookeeper, Maven, JMeter, APR, HTTPD, contributor to Apache Zipkin (incubating), Cordova

quote: The Apache Way is a community of contributors from a diverse set of companies, countries, and skillsets that are committed to helping each other implement and improve useful tools and frameworks that benefit all, done so with the benefit of the projects in mind.
author: Eric E. Payne, Apache Hadoop user since 2011, and contributor to Apache YARN, HDFS, Tez, Falcon, Pig, Hive, HBASE, Storm, Spark

quote: It's a bit rigid but consistent way of developing software, it helps with the ‘trust’ portion of consuming Apache projects.
author: Anonymous user of Apache Maven, Shiro, httpd, httpclient, many other projects for 17 years, contributor to Apache Maven, Shiro, and others

quote: Everything in the open, public, free, fair and friendly.
author: Randy Abernethy, 10 year user of Apache Hadoop, Hive, Spark, Kafka, Cassandra, Thrift, Tomcat, HTTPD, ActiveMQ, contributor to Apache Thrift and others

quote: Transparent communities, community first, open communities
author: Robert Metzger, user of Apache Flink, Kafka, Hadoop, Maven for 10 years, contributor to Apache Flink

quote: A way for me to change the world positively through my passion for coding.
author: Eric Pugh, 16 year user of Apache Turbine, Jakarta, Torque, Solr/Lucene, and contributor to Apache Solr

quote: A way to learn about many stuff and to be part of a great big community
author: Jonathan, user of Apache Commons, Ignite, Tomcat for 6 years, contributor to Apache Ignite

quote: Those who do the work make the decisions. One man projects are failing projects. Community is superior to ability. If it didn't happen on the mailing list, it didn't happen.
author: Nathan Bubna, 18 year user of Apache Velocity, Lucene, contributor to Apache Velocity, Tiles

quote: It completely dominates the way I work, but I tend to have problems with the Non-Apache-Ways
author: Christofer Dutz, 19 year user of Apache Commons, Tomcat, FLEX, PLC4x (incubating), Edgent (incubating), NiFi, Camel, Cocoon, Maven, contributor to Apache PLC4X (incubating)

quote: It is a proven way to deliver high-quality software where the power to make decisions is earned by those who do the work. In my opinion is is the best approach for delivering software we know of - better than any of the trendy approaches used by most software organizations.
author: Matt Ryan, 18 year user and contributor to Jackrabbit, Oak, Sling, Felix, OpenWhisk (incubating), Mesos, Kafka, Storm, Spark, Zookeeper

quote: Meritocracy, Openness, Independence
author: Pavel Tupitsyn, user of Apache Ignite, OpenOffice, log4net, Tomcat for 15 years, contributor to Apache Ignite

quote: Code over words. Community over code
author: Luke, 2 decade user of Apache httpd, Hadoop ecosystem projects, contributor to Apache Hadoop, Pulsar, and more.

quote: It is an unified, systematic and collaborative approach to deliver quality software and documents
author: Gang Wang, user and contributor Apache HTTP Server, Spark, Hadoop, Mnemonic (incubating), Gearpump (incubating), Kylin for 8 years

quote: Community, Open, Do-ocracy, Communication
author: Anonymous user of Apache cTAKES, OpenNLP, UIMA for 5 years, contributor to Apache cTAKES

quote: A culture of collaboration, and focus on the user. Vendor neutral decisions where the needs of the user, and of the community, are put first.
author: Rich Bowen, 24 year user of Apache httpd, APR, numerous Commons projects, Hadoop ecosystem, Spark, Subversion, contributor to Apache httpd, Tomcat, ActiveMQ, CloudStack

quote: Meritocracy, open discussion, voting when needed.
author: Dave, 15+ year user of Apache httpd, Solr, Allura, Hadoop, Hive, SpamAssassin, Subversion, committer to Apache Allura

quote: Doing work in a visible way to invite collaboration and review.
author: Helena, 1 year user and contributor to Apache Geode

quote: The Apache way to me is like a keystone. Climbing up each side of an arch are a committed group of people who must act in some way out of self interest. The Apache way is the keystone that keeps that arch from falling, and converts the collective group's self interest into an altruistic set of projects which are then available freely to the world.
author: Andrew Palumbo, 17 year user of Apache Mahout, Arrow, httpd, Tomcat, Hadoop, Parquet, Commons, Math Commons, Log4j, Poi, Spark, contributor to Apache Mahout, Flink

quote: Means a set of informal rules / behaviours that conducts/helps in the community ecosystem management.
author: Daniel Takabayashi, user of Apache Marvin AI, Hadoop, Spark, Tomcat and more for 15 years, contributes to Marvin AI

quote: Emphasizing community over code to develop technical and collaborative solutions to difficult problems.
author: Andy LoPresto, 15 year user of Apache NiFi, Tomcat, httpd, Solr, Lucene, Groovy, contributor to Apache NiFi, Kafka, Hadoop

quote: Focus on technology first, community effort for the benefit of all
author: Paul, user Apache Drill, Impala, HTTP Web Server, Commons, Calcite, and more for 15 years, contributor to Apache Impala, Drill

quote: Community over code. It's a meritocracy. Transparency, consensus and respect are what make it work.
author: Ken Krugler, 14 year user of Apache Avro, Calcite, Cassandra, Commons, Flink, Hadoop, HttpComponents, James, Kafka, Logging, Lucene, Mahout, Maven, OpenNLP, Parquet, PDFBox, Poi, Solr, Tika, ZooKeeper, contributor to Apache Flink, Tika

quote: Quality, Commitment
author: Gustavo, user of Apache Tomcat, Hadoop, Apache HTTP Server etc. for 15 years

quote: Free Software developed in an open and transparent way
author: Philipp, Apache httpd, Tomcat, commons, Tamaya, Creadur user for 18 years, contributor to Apache Tamaya, Creadur

quote: It means building a good, vibrant community around open source software projects.
author: Thiago H. de Paula Figueiredo, committer to Apache Tapestry, and user of Apache Commons, HttpClient, Shiro for at least 15 years

quote: People working together across the globe in a pragmatic, respectful way to create great OSS products.
author: Jens, user and contributor to Apache Thrift, Cassandra for 5 years

quote: A completely open Open Source development process
author: Alex, user and contributor to Apache Spark, Livy (Incubating), Hadoop, HTTP Server, Ambari, Maven, Bahir, Toree (Incubating), Edgent (Incubating), Arrow, SystemML

quote: Reliable trustworthy open-source software
author: Kevin, user of Apache Maven, Isis, SpamAssassin, since 2002, contributor to Apache Isis

quote: Community over code. An open source codebase doesn't mean much without a community around it, and the Apache Way revolves around enabling communities to govern and maintain projects.
author: Matt Sicker, 15 year user and contributor to Apache httpd, log4j, Commons, Maven, Groovy, and other projects

quote: The Apache Way means doing serious quality software Just for Fun (TM)
author: Helder Miguel Alves Magalhães, ~3 year user of Apache Batik

quote: A formalized framework for creating open source software.
author: Anonymous user of 3 years of Apache Geode, Log4j_2, Lucene Core, Shiro, Tomcat, and perhaps more, contributor to Apache Geode

quote: To help people just because you can :)
author: Maxim, user and contributor to Apache Wicket, OpenMeetings, Commons, Flex, OpenJPA for 20 years

quote: Community and proper software
author: Timothy Spann, 15 year user and contributor to Apache NiFi, MXNet, Tika, OpenNLP, Commons, Hadoop, Hive, Spark, HBase, Ambari, Livy (incubating), Druid (incubating)

quote: Put community before code. Let they that do the work make the decisions. If it didn't happen on a mailing list, it didn't happen. Don't feed the trolls.
author: Anonymous user of Apache HTTP Server and log4j for 15 years and committer on Apache Flume

quote: Good design discussions. User feedback. User driven development.
author: Timo Walther, 6 year user of Apache Flink, Avro, Calcite, Commons, contributor to Apache Flink, Calcite

quote: A licensing model along with some basic guide rails on how to run the open source projects
author: Aaron Fabbri, 20 year user and contributor to 20 years to Apache Hadoop, Impala, Kudu

quote: Community first: the project by the community, for the community. Collaborative and open: reach consensus through discussion and encourage broad contributions. Merit-based governance: give those every contributor a chance to collaborate and lead the community. Archivable discussion and design: enable everyone in the community to participate regardless when or how they want to contribute.
author: Tianqi Chen, 2 year user and contributor to Apache MXNet (incubating)

quote: Work together to change the world online
author: Lin Zhinan, user and contributor of 8 years to Apache ServiceComb and Tomcat

quote: Culture of collaboration, respect, openness.
author: Anonymous user of Apache httpd, Tomcat, Maven, Commons, Logging, log4j, POI, FOP, Axis2 for 23 years

quote: Community
author: César José García León, 10+ year user of Apache Karaf, Tomcat, Commons, contributes to Apache Karaf

quote: Open opportunity to developer
author: Vnk, user of Apache Spark, Hadoop, Hive, log4j for 8 years

quote: Freedom, choice and affordability
author: Ajay, 8 year user of Apache Hadoop, Ozone, and contributor to Apache Hadoop, Ozone, Yarn, Ranger, Hive, HBase, Pig

quote: help others, collaborate and share ideas on enterprise opensource projects without promoting enterprises interests but contributors.
author: Pierre-Luc Dion, user of Apache httpd, Tomcat, CloudStack, Hadoop, HBase, Kafka since 1997, contributor to Apache CloudStack, Spot

quote: A way of working on software that is inclusive and well governed, while at the same time being very grass roots.
author: Frank McQuillan, 5 year user and contributor to Apache MADlib, HAWQ, Hive, HTTP Server, Kafka, Spark, Tomcat, Zeppelin, ZooKeeper

quote: Win Win way
author: Jayesh, 2+ year user Apache Lucene, Solr, Commons, Tika, Nutch, Tomcat, POI, Zookeeper, OpenNLP, and hopes to become a contributor this year.

quote: Collaborate on software from people all over the world, and use consensus to continuously improve the software.
author: Fokko Driesprong, user of Apache Spark, Airflow, Avro, Parquet, Hive, Zookeeper, Maven, Yetus and others for many years, contributor to Apache Airflow

quote: Collaboration
author: Avik Ganguly, 8 year user of Apache Fineract, Cassandra, Commons, Maven, Tomcat, and others, contributor to Apache Fineract

quote: Freedom
author: Soner, 3 year user of Apache Spark, Hive, Kafka, Sqoop

quote: Respect to community
author: Jongyoul, 18 year user of Apache HTTP Server, Spark, Zeppelin, Hadoop, Hive, contributor to Apache Zeppelin, Spar, YARN, Airflow

quote: Very open high quality software
author: Anonymous, 14 year user of Apache Velocity, httpd, FOP, Sling, Tomcat, contributor to Apache Velocity

quote: Good provider for software; nice community to work in
author: Anonymous user of Apache Ant, Maven, Deltaspike, Camel, Commons since 1996, contributor to Apache Ant, Commons, Camel, Deltaspike

quote: A rich and elaborate bureaucracy that keeps despots and corporations taking over OSS projects, and encourages people world wide to take part in projects based on ability.
author: Trevor Grant, 20 year user of Apache Mahout, Spark, Flink, Kafka, OpenWhisk (incubating), Streams, other Hadoop ecosystem projects, contributor to Apache Mahout, Streams, Spark, Flink, many others

quote: The Apache Way is a fair method of collaboration, even between competitors.
author: Myrle Krantz, 12 year user of Apache Xerces, Lucene, Cassandra, Tomcat, contributor to Apache Fineract

quote: Open, Freedom and Respect.
author: Anu Engineer, 5 year user and contributor to Apache Hadoop

quote: At the core: Open Governance. It's more than Open Source. The playing field is level for individuals as well as huge corporate interests. No entity can buy a seat at the table.
author: Daniel Ruggeri, 15 year user and contributor to Apache HTTP Server and Tomcat

quote: creating free (as in freedom) software, transparent communication and decision making, independence from company interests
author: Thomas, 15 year user of Apache Tomcat, Commons, HTTP Server, Derby, Torque

quote: The opportunity of working on world level projects, with world level workmates, having world level users, with no boss :) only based on meritocracy nothing else.
author: Yasser Zamani, 7 year user and contributor to Apache Struts

quote: community, living open source, keeping different kind of os communities together, defining standards, very democratic and transparent decision making apparently
author: Georg, user of Apache Solr, Commons, Turbine, Databases, Subversion, HTTP Server, Tomcat since 1999

quote: Open source software development with well defined processes and roles.
author: Boglarka Egyed, 3 year user of Apache Hadoop and Sqoop, contributor to Apache Sqoop

quote: An open to all self sustaining way forward
author: Govind Menon, user of Apache Storm, Zookeeper, Tomcat, Camel for 5 years, contributor to Apache Storm

quote: Code-centric community development.
author: Adam Soroka, 20+ year user of too many Apache projects to name, mostly httpd, Commons, Jena, Cassandra, Derby

quote: well structured approach to open source development.
author: Anonymous ~10 year user of Apache Maven, Tomcat, Ignite, contributor to Apache Ignite

quote: Meritocracy, do-ocracy
author: David Smiley, 19 year user of Apache Ant, Maven, Lucene, Solr, HttpClient, contributor to Apache Lucene, Solr

quote: Open source and always on the edge
author: Anonymous user of Apache Maven, Tomcat, Spark, Kafka for 4 years

quote: Sharing knowledge and ideas with the community. Working together to provide solutions.
author: Michael, 15 year user of Apache Olingo, HTTP Server, CXF, Qpid, contributor to Apache Olingo, Qpid

quote: Open Source Software according to defined rules
author: Anonymous, 15 year user and contributor to Apache Commons, CXF, FreeMarker, Kafka, Logging (log4j2), Maven, Tomcat, and for sure others because of dependencies

quote: A community of developers dedicated to helping every developer to become proficient
author: Anonymous user to Apache Ant, Commons, DB, Groovy, HttpComponents, Logging, Maven, NiFi, POI, Subversion, Tomcat, Xerces for as long as they’ve been using Java, about 20 years

quote: A project free from commercial coercion, but with strict regulations and daunting processes
author: Anonymous user of Apache Groovy, Maven, JMeter, Kafka, Netbeans, Tinkerpop, Tomcat for 10 years, contributor to Apache Groovy

quote: Freedom and quality
author: Juan Moreno, 10 year user of Apache httpd, NetBeans, Tomcat, Maven, contributor to Apache CXF

quote: Easy accessible open source and sometimes very old looking projects.
author: Anonymous user of Apache NetBeans, Commons Java libraries, Hadoop for 10 years, colleagues contribute to various Apache projects

quote: It Means a lot with the way the projects help in our day to day life and the reusability from a big picture point of view
author: Kumaran Ravi Prakash, 8 year user of Apache POI, Ant, Maven, Groovy, Cordova, has not yet contributed but would like to contribute

quote: It means an open place to collaborate
author: Sascha. 10+ year user of Apache httpd, Lucene, Karaf, Aries, Commons, and many more, contributor to Apache Aries, Karaf, Archiva and others when they find something

quote: A neutral space in which to collaborate on software components (not software products). A way to protect open source as a development methodology that delivers innovation to those participating.
author: Anonymous 18 year user and contributor to too many Apache projects to write down

quote: Keeping health community around shared software as common goods in collective, inclusive, practical ways, under the meritocratic--against aristocratic, credits earned by contributed merits--governance model.
author: Anonymous 18 year user of Apache HTTP Server, Tomcat, Commons, Portals, Jackrabbit, Lucene, Solr, Tika, James, JMeter, FreeMarker, Logging, CXF, Maven, Ant, Wicket, HttpComponents, POI, Xerces, Xalan, Nutch, Hadoop, Velocity, contributor to Apache Portals, Commons, FreeMarker, Tomcat, Jackrabbit, Cocoon, Syncope

quote: Excellent software that I can trust to be supported and enhanced going forward, with a clear path to retirement should that be appropriate.  Clear licensing without any gotchas.
author: Jan, user of Apache HTTP Server, Java Commons, Groovy, NetBeans since the first apache httpd

quote: I can share what I do with anyone and everyone.  Also, the Apache License 2.0 has been the standard OS license used by pretty much everyone I have worked for.
author: Craig McClanahan, 19 year user of Apache Tomcat, Struts, Commons, Maven, contributor to Apache Tomcat, Struts (original creator), Commons

quote: Consensus-based, community driven governance
author: Rajind Ruparathna, 7+ year user of Apache Maven, Commons IO/Lang/HttpClient, POI, Zookeeper, Log4J 2, ActiveMQ, Spark, LibCloud, Commons Logging, HttpComponents, Lucene, Pig, Shiro, Solr, Storm, Tika, Tomcat, Velocity, Xerces, contributor to Apache Bloodhound, Apache OODT, HttpComponents

quote: It's a great opportunity to use software freely.
author: Anonymous 16 year user of Apache httpd, OpenOffice

quote: In general a nice and clean approach, but sometimes people who are good at networking can create opinions that are used to push contributors into a specific corner. In addition some discussions are more political than for the project itself.
author: Markus Geiss, 10 year user of Apache Lucene, Cassandra, Derby, DBCP, Fineract, contributor to Apache Fineract

quote: We, as professionals and hobbyists, have the choice to share our knowledge to perform together for the best.
author: Sylvain user of Apache Commons IO, Lang, Tomcat, Mina, log4j and logback, Derby, HTTP Server for 13 years

quote: Community spirit
author: Rachel Zou, one year user and contributor to Apache Kylin

quote: open, respect and collaborate
author: Shaofeng Shi, 15 year user of Apache Tomcat, Kylin, Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, MyBatis, HBase, Flink, contributor to Apache Kylin, Superset, Spark

quote: open, sharing, global team work
author: Jason Zhong, 10 year user of Apache Kylin, Hadoop, contributor to Apache Kylin

quote: That the projects are supported by durable communities that span the interests of multiple organizations, and that the communities are self-organizing meritocracies.
author: Michael Beckerle, 15 year user of too many to keep track of, contributor to Apache Daffodil (incubating)

quote: It means that I'm invited to share something great with the world. It means that I invite the world to enjoy it and to make it better because everything can get better, but it gets better when we work together. No one is forced to contribute their code here, they are invited to do so. This means that if you see code here, it's code that we feel is worthy to be shared. It means that good code will win the day.
author: Gil Yehuda, 9 year user of Apache Hadoop, Storm, Hive, Oozie, Zookeeper, Traffic Server, Omid, Druid, and more; employer has 50 employees who have as their full time job to contribute to Apache projects and over 25 people who are on PMCs

quote: A new paradigm and a social framework for open source community and project governance in China.
author: Ted Liu, 15 year user of Apache HTTP Server, contributor to Apache Spark, Hadoop, Mesos, Cloudera, RocketMQ, Eagle, Griffin, Kylin, Weex, Doris, ECharts, CarbonData, Camel, ServiceComb, SkyWalking, Dubbo, HAWQ, Sharding-Sphere, BRPC

quote: Charity, Community, Open
author: Zhangliang, 10 year user of Apache Tomcat, ShardingSphere, Zookeeper, Hadoop, Maven, contributor to ShardingSphere

quote: It is to produce opensource analogs of proprietary software
author: Emil Bogomolov, 1 year user of Apache Hadoop and derivatives

quote: The way Apache builds and advocates software is the way software should be built which is through global collaboration.
author: Anonymous 10 year user of Apache Spark, Hadoop, Tomcat, httpd

quote: Great software, collaboration, shared knowledge
author: Roy, user of Apache Tomcat, Kafka, JMeter, Ant, Avro, Commons, log4j, Qpid, Spark, Struts, Zookeeper for 15 years, contributor to Apache Camel

quote: Freedom and Voluntary Collaboration
author: Niclas Hedhman, user of too many Apache projects since 1997, patches contributor to 30 or so total projects

quote: Free open solid quality
author: Paul Velthuis, 7 year user of Apache Airflow, Spark, Beam, HTTP Server, Cassandra, Hive, Log4j, contributor to Apache Airflow, Beam, Spark

quote: The new paradigm of code manufacturing
author: Faouz, 5 year user of Apache Spark, Airflow, contributor to Apache Airflow

quote: My idea for the largest open source contributor.
author: Balaji Swaminathan, user of Apache Solr, log4j, Tomcat, Lucene and a lot more for 5 years

quote: Reliable open source software
author: Florian, 15 year user of Apache Tomcat and all sorts of Java libraries, contributor to Apache HTTP Server

quote: That the community and its sustainability are more important than the code itself.
author: Andrew Janke, 18 year user of Apache Ant, Maven, Commons, NetBeans, httpd, Subversion, OpenOffice, Derby, Batik, FOP, CXF, Tomcat, HttpComponentsClient, Log4j

quote: Collaborate, ship early, often, and in the open
author: Jordan Hamel, user of Apache Lucene, Kafka, Spark, Traffic Server, Airflow, Pulsar since 1998, contributor to Apache Geronimo

quote: Sharing knowledge is the only way to become more knowledgeable.
author: Aram Mirzadeh, user of Apache httpd, Commons, FOP, HTTPComponents, POI, Tomcat, more for 24 years, contributor to many Apache projects

quote: dropping corporate affiliation. working with and learning from folks across the planet, that you may not meet otherwise.
author: Anonymous user and contributor to Apache Lucene for 10 years

quote: excellent initiative - no dependency to majors.
author: Alexandre Labiche, user of 15% of Apache projects for 20 years

quote: Collaborative development in a respectful atmosphere to make  the world better through software
author: Anonymous Open Source legal advisor for 10 years

quote: Means ensuring high quality open source software under the supervision of an independent institution like ASF
author: Anonymous 10 year user of Apache Tomcat, Wicket, Commons, Maven, Camel, contributor to Apache Wicket

quote: community beyond commercial offerings
author: Mei Long, 18 year user of Apache Zeppelin, Spark, Hadoop, Lucene, Hive, Maven, Cassandra, contributor to Apache Zeppelin

quote: Community delivering results by focusing on good practices, knowledge sharing, meritocracy and openness.
author: Karol Brejna, 12 year user of Apache Kafka, ZooKeeper, Hadoop, Spark, Beam, Incubator, Commons, Maven, Mesos, Tomcat, Tika, HTTP Server, contributor to Apache Beam, Hadoop, Incubator

quote: is all about the freedom to contribute. If I have a good idea or an answer to a question I am free to jump in! All that matters is the quality of your work. The Apache Way also fuels people to want to help others. You will get a response from a user list faster than messaging folks in your own company!
author: Amanda Moran, 4 year user of Apache Cassandra, Spark and Trafodion, contributor to Apache Trafodion
